manipulation

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • manipulation.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends java.lang.Object

    Class provides a collection of common functions to be used by other classes

        public static void removeTempFolder()

        Deletes the temp directory and files from the file system.

      • audioStreamToByte

        public static byte[] audioStreamToByte(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audio)
                                throws java.io.IOException

        Generates a byte array from an AudioInputStream object.

        The byte array is represetive of the audio data of the object, allowing for manipulation.

        Parameters:
        audio - the AudioInputStream object to get an array from
        Returns:
        the byte array of the audio data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • bufferedImageToByte

        public static byte[] bufferedImageToByte(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)

        Gets the editable data from a buffered image, in a byte array format

        Parameters:
        image - the bufferedImage to get the data from
        Returns:
        a byte array for the editable data

        Parameters:
        imageData - the byte array containing the image data
        Returns:
        a bufferedImage representative of the byte array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • shortToByteArray

        public static byte[] shortToByteArray(short value)

        Used to create the byte representation of a short value, used for embedding message length into the covertext. The array uses big endian to store the value.

        Parameters:
        value - the short value of which the byte array will represent
        Returns:
        the byte array representative of a

        Returns:

      • joinByteArray

        public static byte[] joinByteArray(byte[] one,
                                   byte[] two)

        Concatenates two supplied byte arrays.

        Parameters:
        one - byte array to be positioned first in the concatenated array
        two - byte array to be positioned second in the concatenated array
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the elements of the two supplied arrays

      • insertAt

        public static byte[] insertAt(byte[] original,
                              byte[] content,
                              int index)

        Inserts a byte array, content, within another array, original, at the given index.

        Parameters:
        original - byte array which will have an array, content, inserted into
        content - byte array which will be inserted into original
        index - the index of which the content array will be inserted into original
        Returns:
        the resulting array of the insertion

      • stringToByte

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a byte array equal to the representation of the string
